data.event: The town was named in 1876 by postmaster Robert Allen, after his place of birth, Winton, Dorset.
In 2015 the Sydney Morning Herald reported that recent seismic studies indicated that 300 million years ago an asteroid or comet struck the area releasing energy equivalent to 650 Hiroshima A-bombs.
In 2015 the Sydney Morning Herald reported that recent seismic studies indicated that 300 million years ago an asteroid or comet struck the area releasing energy equivalent to 650 Hiroshima A-bombs.

event.title: 2009, three dinosaur genera, Australovenator, Wintonotitan and Diamantinasaurus, were discovered

data.event: In 2009, three dinosaur genera, Australovenator, Wintonotitan and Diamantinasaurus, were discovered near the town.
